info.title: Creating a template from the delivered VMDK image

abstract.para: Creating a virtual machine template with a pre-configured &productname; accelarates future deployment and keeps the delivered image untouched.

topic.para: To create the template, you first need to import the &productname; VMDK image, then create a machine from the imported image and then convert the machine into a template. All steps are described in following sections.

step.para: Navigate to the Staging area and select the uploaded image.
Click MOVE TO to copy the image to the Imported VMDKs location and confirm with OK. Wait for the process to be complete.

section.title: Creating a virtual machine
section.para: Now you need to create a virtual machine from the image. To do so, proceed as follows:

step.para: Navigate to the VMs and Templates view.
Right click on the cluster and host, where you want to create the virtual machine, and select New Virtual Machine.
The wizard for adding virtual machine details opens. Details see in the following procedure.
Under Select a creation type choose Create a New Virtual Machine and proceed with Next.
Under Select a name and folder, fill in the Virtual machine name and select a location for the mahine. Proceed with Next.
Under Select a compute resource click the destination machine IP address on the list. Proceed with Next.
Under Select storage click the target datastore on the right and click Next.
Under Select compatilibity select ESX 6.7 and later and proceed with Next.
Under Select a guest OS choose Linux as the Guest OS Family and as the Guest OS Version select SUSE Linux Enterprise 15 (64-bit). Proceed with Next.
Under Customize hardware, perform the following steps:
Remove the preconfigured hard disk.
Click ADD NEW DEVICE and Existing Hard Disk
Select a datastore and click OK.
In the Select File window under Imported VMDKs select the &productname; image and proceed with OK.
Click Advanced Parameters. Set the Attribute to guestinfo.userdata.encoding and set its value to base64. Click Add.
Add another Attribute: guestinfo.userdata and to the value field add the encoded user data.
Proceed with Next.
In Ready to complete review the configuration and f everything is correct, click Finish.
The template should appear in the Hosts and Clusters view.

section.title: Installing the virtual machine
section.para: After the configuration is finished, you can start the installation of the virtual machine as described below.

step.para: Navigate to the Hosts and Clusters view and select the &productname; template.
Click the Power on icon.
Open the web console to monitor the installation process.
After the installation is complete, the virtual machine should power off as configured in the provided user data.

section.title: Converting the virtual machine into a template
section.para: The final part of the deployment is to create a template from the configured machine that can be used to clone virtual machines from and thus speed up the later deployment.

step.para: Navigate to the VMs and Templates and select the template there.
Either click Actions and in the roll-up menu select Template or right-click on the template
